definition[0]: to move backwards, away from someone or something
example[0]: She backed off and then turned and ran.
definition[1]: to stop telling someone what to do, or stop criticizing them, especially so that they can deal with something themselves
example[1]: I think you should back off for a while.
example[2]: Back off, Marc! Let me run my own life!
definition[2]: to stop supporting something, or decide not to do something you were planning to do
example[3]: Jerry backed off when he realized how much work was involved.
example[4]: The company has backed off from investing new money.
